Participants must:

  • Be at least 12 years old
  • Have had asthma for at least 6 months
  • Currently be treated with a daily medium/high dose asthma inhaler
entries.ineligibilityCriteria:
Participants must not:

  • Have a history of smoking (within the past 6 months, or have smoked one pack a day for 10+ years)

entries.faqOne:
What are clinical trials?

Clinical trials (also called clinical research) are research studies to determine whether investigational drugs or treatments are safe and effective for humans. All investigational medications and devices must undergo clinical trials before they are made available to patients.

Can I decide to leave a clinical trial?

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.
entries.faqTwo:
What are the benefits and risks of clinical trials?

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. It's important to discuss the benefits and risks with either your doctor or the clinical trial site contact before making any decisions.

Before you can participate in any clinical trial, you will be asked to review and sign an informed cosent form(ICF), which will explain the potential benefits, risks, and side effects that you may experience while taking part in the clinical trial. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.
entries.landingBody: For some people with asthma, symptoms are not well controlled on current medications. These studies are researching an investigational medication for patients with uncontrolled or severe asthma. The study drug is being tested to determine if it can reduce inflammation in patients' airways, improve asthma symptoms and decrease the number of asthma attacks.
entries.landingFooter: If you would like to speak to someone regarding this trial first check to see if you are eligible above. If it seems that you are eligible to take part, you will be contacted by phone, and you will be able to ask any additional questions you may have about this clinical trial.

Clinical trials (also called clinical research) are research studies to determine whether investigational drugs or treatments are safe and effective for humans. All investigational medications and devices must undergo clinical trials before they are made available to patients.

Can I decide to leave a clinical trial?

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.
entries.faqTwo:
What are the benefits and risks of clinical trials?

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. It's important to discuss the benefits and risks with either your doctor or the clinical trial site contact before making any decisions.

Before you can participate in any clinical trial, you will be asked to review and sign an informed cosent form(ICF), which will explain the potential benefits, risks, and side effects that you may experience while taking part in the clinical trial. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.
entries.landingBody: For some people with asthma, symptoms are not well controlled on current medications. These studies are researching an investigational medication for patients with uncontrolled or severe asthma. The study drug is being tested to determine if it can reduce inflammation in patients' airways, improve asthma symptoms and decrease the number of asthma attacks.
entries.landingFooter: If you would like to speak to someone regarding this trial first check to see if you are eligible above. If it seems that you are eligible to take part, you will be contacted by phone, and you will be able to ask any additional questions you may have about this clinical trial.

entries.name: novartis-qaw
entries.duration: This trial is up to 64 weeks long, requiring up to 11 visits, up to 6 telephone visits, and no overnight stays.
entries.costs: All study related medications and procedures will be provided.
entries.eligibilityCriteria:
Participants must:

  • Be at least 12 years old
  • Have had asthma for at least 6 months
  • Currently be treated with a daily medium/high dose asthma inhaler
entries.ineligibilityCriteria:
Participants must not:

  • Have a history of smoking (within the past 6 months, or have smoked one pack a day for 10+ years)
  • Be lactose intolerant

entries.faqOne:
What are clinical trials?

Clinical trials (also called clinical research) are research studies to determine whether investigational drugs or treatments are safe and effective for humans. All investigational medications and devices must undergo clinical trials before they are made available to patients.

Can I decide to leave a clinical trial?

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.
entries.faqTwo:
What are the benefits and risks of clinical trials?

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. It's important to discuss the benefits and risks with either your doctor or the clinical trial site contact before making any decisions.

Before you can participate in any clinical trial, you will be asked to review and sign an informed cosent form(ICF), which will explain the potential benefits, risks, and side effects that you may experience while taking part in the clinical trial. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.
entries.landingBody: For some people with asthma, symptoms are not well controlled on current medications. These studies are researching an investigational medication for patients with uncontrolled or severe asthma. The study drug is being tested to determine if it can reduce inflammation in patients' airways, improve asthma symptoms and decrease the number of asthma attacks.

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. entries.faqTwo:

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.

entries.faqOne:
What are clinical trials?

Clinical trials (also called clinical research) are research studies to determine whether investigational drugs or treatments are safe and effective for humans. All investigational medications and devices must undergo clinical trials before they are made available to patients.

Can I decide to leave a clinical trial?

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.
entries.faqTwo:
What are the benefits and risks of clinical trials?

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. It's important to discuss the benefits and risks with either your doctor or the clinical trial site contact before making any decisions.

Before you can participate in any clinical trial, you will be asked to review and sign an informed cosent form(ICF), which will explain the potential benefits, risks, and side effects that you may experience while taking part in the clinical trial. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.
entries.landingBody: For some people with asthma, symptoms are not well controlled on current medications. These studies are researching an investigational medication for patients with uncontrolled or severe asthma. The study drug is being tested to determine if it can reduce inflammation in patients' airways, improve asthma symptoms and decrease the number of asthma attacks.

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.
entries.faqTwo:
What are the benefits and risks of clinical trials?

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. It's important to discuss the benefits and risks with either your doctor or the clinical trial site contact before making any decisions.

Before you can participate in any clinical trial, you will be asked to review and sign an informed cosent form(ICF), which will explain the potential benefits, risks, and side effects that you may experience while taking part in the clinical trial. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.
entries.landingBody: For some people with asthma, symptoms are not well controlled on current medications. These studies are researching an investigational medication for patients with uncontrolled or severe asthma. The study drug is being tested to determine if it can reduce inflammation in patients' airways, improve asthma symptoms and decrease the number of asthma attacks.

entries.faqOne:
What are clinical trials?

Clinical trials (also called clinical research) are research studies to determine whether investigational drugs or treatments are safe and effective for humans. All investigational medications and devices must undergo clinical trials before they are made available to patients.

Can I decide to leave a clinical trial?

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.
entries.faqTwo:
What are the benefits and risks of clinical trials?

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. It's important to discuss the benefits and risks with either your doctor or the clinical trial site contact before making any decisions.

Before you can participate in any clinical trial, you will be asked to review and sign an informed cosent form(ICF), which will explain the potential benefits, risks, and side effects that you may experience while taking part in the clinical trial. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.

entries.name: novartis-qaw
entries.duration: This trial is up to 64 weeks long, requiring up to 11 visits, up to 6 telephone visits, and no overnight stays.
entries.costs: All study related medications and procedures will be provided.
entries.eligibilityCriteria:
Participants must:

  • Be at least 12 years old
  • Have had asthma for at least 6 months
  • Currently be treated with a daily medium/high dose asthma inhaler
entries.ineligibilityCriteria:
Participants must not:

  • Have a history of smoking (within the past 6 months, or have smoked one pack a day for 10+ years)
  • Be lactose intolerant
entries.faqOne:
What are clinical trials?

Clinical trials (also called clinical research) are research studies to determine whether investigational drugs or treatments are safe and effective for humans. All investigational medications and devices must undergo clinical trials before they are made available to patients.

Can I decide to leave a clinical trial?

You can decide to leave a clinical trial at any time, and you do not have to give a reason. There is no charge or penalty if you decided not to take part in a clinical trial.

Why should I participate in a clinical trial?

You will have access to investigational medications that, if approved, will be available to the general public. You will also receive study-related medical care and attention from clinical trial staff at research facilities. Clinical trials offer an opportunity to help researchers find better treatments for others in the future.
entries.faqTwo:
What are the benefits and risks of clinical trials?

The investigational treatment may or may not help to make your condition better. While you may have a positive trial experience, you may also experience unpleasant or serious side effects. It's important to discuss the benefits and risks with either your doctor or the clinical trial site contact before making any decisions.

Before you can participate in any clinical trial, you will be asked to review and sign an informed cosent form(ICF), which will explain the potential benefits, risks, and side effects that you may experience while taking part in the clinical trial. Signinin it indicates you are agreeing to take part in this research study.

Is my information safe?

Your information will be kept confidentioal within the limits of the law of your country. If the results of this clinical trial are published or presented in a meeting, you will not be named and nobody will be able to tell that you were in the trial from the publication or presentation.
entries.landingBody: For some people with asthma, symptoms are not well controlled on current medications. These studies are researching an investigational medication for patients with uncontrolled or severe asthma. The study drug is being tested to determine if it can reduce inflammation in patients' airways, improve asthma symptoms and decrease the number of asthma attacks.
entries.landingFooter: If you would like to speak to someone regarding this trial first check to see if you are eligible above. If it seems that you are eligible to take part, you will be contacted by phone, and you will be able to ask any additional questions you may have about this clinical trial.
